availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Dugan (Portsmouth, Ohio, banker and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Portsmouth, Ohio, banker and commissioner of deeds. Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, native. Married to Lavina Dugan. Father of James S. Dugan, Mary F. Dugan, and Betty Dugan. Banker in Portsmouth in 1860. Partner in the Banking House of Thomas Dugan and Co. in 1865. Commissioner of deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in the State of Ohio in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Scioto County, Portsmouth, p. 158-59; "Ohio, County Death Records, 1840-2001," database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:F624-SXJ : 13 December 2014), Thomas Dugan, 18 Nov 1873; citing Death, Portsmouth, Portsmouth City, Scioto, Ohio, United States, source ID v 1 p 92-93, County courthouses, Ohio; FHL microfilm 292,722; KYR-0001-007-0392.
